claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

extracted_evidence.quote: For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia 30 2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm 09 like virus) (H1 N1), A/Massachusetts/18/ 2022 (H3 N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explicitly states the total and per-strain hemagglutinin (HA) content in Flublok, which is 135 mcg per dose (45 mcg per strain), supporting the claim that Flublok contains 3x the HA antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines (which typically contain 15 mcg per strain).

extracted_evidence.quote: 3. Keitel WA, Treanor JJ, El Sahly HM, et.al. Comparative immunogenicity of recombinant influenza hemagglutinin (rHA) and trivalent inactivated vaccines (TIVs) among persons ≥65 years old. Vaccine. 2009, Vol. 28, pp. 379-385.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This reference is cited in the context of clinical studies comparing the immunogenicity of Flublok (which contains higher HA content) to standard trivalent inactivated vaccines, directly supporting the claim that higher HA content is linked to greater immunogenicity.
